pt: {sc}accidental{/sc} {sc}fortuitous{/sc} {sc}casual{/sc} {sc}contingent{/sc} mean not amenable to planning or prediction. {sc}accidental{/sc} stresses chance.

pt.t: any resemblance to actual persons is entirely {it}accidental{/it}

pt: {sc}fortuitous{/sc} so strongly suggests chance that it often connotes entire absence of cause.
{sc}casual{/sc} stresses lack of real or apparent premeditation or intent.
{sc}contingent{/sc} suggests possibility of happening but stresses uncertainty and dependence on other future events for existence or occurrence.

pt.t: the {it}contingent{/it} effects of the proposed law

pt: {sc}random{/sc} {sc}haphazard{/sc} {sc}casual{/sc} mean determined by accident rather than design. {sc}random{/sc} stresses lack of definite aim, fixed goal, or regular procedure.
{sc}haphazard{/sc} applies to what is done without regard for regularity or fitness or ultimate consequence.
{sc}casual{/sc} suggests working or acting without deliberation, intention, or purpose.
